result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) and OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Wendy L Reusch was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Brookfield Police Department and to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

AMENDED 05-20-2014:  The Court removes this condition from the Conditions of Probation.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
The Court recommends the Department of Corrections supervise the defendant in accordance with the standards defined in DOC Administrative Directive 10-04.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Provide a DNA sample if not yet provided.
Attend 2 self help meetings per week.
6 months of Day Report Center, consecutive to Condition Time, DRC is authorized to utilize the SCRAM monitoring.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Wendy L Reusch in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed by operation of law.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days) - consecutive to any sentence currently serving. 
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

*TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling
*No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
*Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
*Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
*The court recommends the Department of Corrections supervise the defendant in accordance with the standards defined in DOC Administrative Directive 10-04.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done
*Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. 
*Attend 2 self help meetings per week. 
*6 months of Day Report Center, consecutive to condition time, DRC is authorized to utilize the SCRAM monitoring. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to Town of Brookfield Police Department);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of probation).  

FINE:  $1519 ((to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  180 DAYS - NON WORKING HOURS w/standard release conditions.  Consecutive to sentence currently serving. 

IF REVOKED: 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
